employees.notes: Proff lists headcount as 215 employees on the company profile.[1]

revenue.notes: Proff reports 2024 operating revenue as 1,093,986 with amounts stated in thousands (NOK), converted here to NOK 1,093,986,000.[1]

company.entity_resolution_notes: The matched Norwegian legal entity is FORESTIA AS (Aksjeselskap) with org number 981 393 961 on Proff, consistent with the Braskereidfoss industrial operation.[1]

srm_assessment.overall_summary: Forestia shows evidence of inbound secondary bio-based input use: wood by-products/waste-derived chips from sawmills used in chipboard production, indicating core relevance to production.[2][3] Forestia also has an ongoing return-wood project (demolition wood cleaning/reuse) supported by public funding, but operational volumes are not disclosed.[2][3]

srm_inputs.label: Sawmill by-product wood chips
srm_inputs.used_for: Forestia states it procures wood as by-products from sawmills for board production, and group reporting states these chips are used in chipboards.[2][3]
srm_inputs.tier_reasoning: The input is described as "large amounts" and directly tied to chipboard production, indicating a core production input rather than pilot use.[2][3]
srm_inputs.volume_notes: No Forestia-specific annual tonnage of inbound sawmill by-product chips is disclosed in the identified public sources.[2][3]
srm_inputs.uncertainties: One statement is group-level (Byggma) and may not isolate Forestia volumes; however, Forestia-specific text confirms by-product sourcing.[2][3]

srm_inputs.label: Return wood (demolition wood) for new chipboard feedstock
srm_inputs.used_for: Forestia reports an ongoing project to clean demolition wood and recycle it into new boards/chipboard feedstock.[2][3]
srm_inputs.tier_reasoning: Evidence indicates an ongoing investment/project phase with support funding, but no confirmed steady-state operational input volume is provided.[2][3]
srm_inputs.volume_notes: Available figures describe project support (MNOK 80) rather than measured annual inbound mass/volume of return wood.[3]
srm_inputs.uncertainties: Sources do not confirm actual annual processed return-wood quantities or the exact commissioning/operational status of the line.[2][3]

gaps_and_uncertainties: No public Forestia-specific annual quantity (t, m3) for inbound secondary raw materials was found in the reviewed sources.[2][3]
No disclosed share of secondary inputs versus total wood feedstock was found.[2][3]
Project evidence for demolition wood is strong, but operational throughput and year-specific realized use remain undisclosed.[2][3]
